summary: the median age was 3.3 years old and 1,003 patients were male (54%). influenza A was diagnosed in 1,357 cases (68%), influenza B in 624 (31%) and both influenza A and B in 21 (1%). influenza virus A was detected in 116 (69.4%), B in 50 (29.9%) and both A and B in one case (0.6%). three patients died of encephalopathy (n = 1) and combined encephalopathy/myocarditis (n = 2). Conclusion IANCs is not rare and may cause serious outcome including death.
